New Records: The Angels set a franchise record for losses in a season
The White Sox almost set the major league record for most losses in a season
Key Match Events: Andrew Vaughn hit a high, lazy pop up that somehow turned into a home run in the top of the fourth
The game ended in the 13th inning, on yet another single deflected off the glove of a White Sox infielder
Pre-Game Insights: Kurt Squire, a UC Irvine informatics professor and die-hard White Sox fan, had been attending a full series every season since 2017 and invited White Sox fans to join him
The official attendance was 22,757, less than half of Angel Stadium's capacity
Post-Match Reflections: Squire felt relief and existential dread after the game
He hugged the other White Sox fans and headed out of the ballpark
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stadium was empty, with a handful of people decked out in White Sox gear trickling in
The Angels' collapse helped the White Sox avoid setting the record for losses in a season
The game was a cavalcade of clumsiness, with not a single All-Star in the starting lineup for either team
